item.title: Ariel add a quote by David Guterson
item.description: "The snowfall obliterated the borders between the fields and made Kabuo Miyamoto's long-cherished seven acres indistinguishable from the land that surrounded them. All human claims to the landscape were superseded, made null and void by the snow. The world was one world, and the notion that a man might kill another over some small patch of it did not make sense." -- David Guterson

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "And have you never known the pleasure and triumph of a lucky guess? I pity you. I thought you cleverer; for depend upon it, a lucky guess is never merely luck. There is always some talent in it." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Water, water, everywhere, And all the boards did shrink; Water, water, everywhere, Nor any drop to drink." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Ariel add a quote by David Guterson
item.description: "None of those other things makes a difference. Love is the strongest thing in the world, you know. Nothing can touch it. Nothing comes close. If we love each other we're safe from it all. Love is the biggest thing there is." -- David Guterson

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "How dangerous is the acquirement of knowledge and how much happier that man is who believes his native town to be the world, than he who aspires to be greater than his nature will allow." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Ariel add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a fair, even-handed, noble adjustment of things, that while there is infection in disease and sorrow, there is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humour." -- Charles Dickens
